title: Open Agent Threat Format (OATF) v0.1
description: Schema for validating OATF documents that describe security threats against AI agent communication protocols (MCP, A2A, AG-UI).

$schema.description: URL pointing to this JSON Schema for IDE validation and autocompletion.

oatf.description: The OATF specification version. Must be "0.1" for this schema.

attack.description: The attack definition. Exactly one per document.

SeverityLevel.description: Severity classification from informational (observation only) to critical (full compromise).

Protocol.description: Agent communication protocol identifier. Open string; v0.1 defines: mcp, a2a, ag_ui. Used by indicators to specify which protocol's traffic to match against.

Mode.description: Attacker posture: {protocol}_{role} convention. Open string; v0.1 defines: mcp_server, mcp_client, a2a_server, a2a_client, ag_ui_client. The protocol component (before _server/_client) identifies the binding; the role determines client vs server behavior.

Impact.description: Category of harm: what happens when the attack succeeds.

Duration.description: Time duration. Shorthand (30s, 5m, 1h, 2d) or ISO 8601 (PT30S, PT5M30S, P1DT12H).

Surface.description: Protocol-specific attack surface being examined. Values for v0.1 bindings are defined in the protocol binding sections (spec §7). Surfaces for unrecognized bindings are structurally valid; tools MUST skip surface validation for unrecognized protocols.

MatchCondition.description: A single condition operator or combination of operators (AND logic). At least one operator key (contains, starts_with, ends_with, regex, any_of, gt, lt, gte, lte) MUST be present. Extension fields (x-) do not satisfy this requirement.

regex.description: RE2-compatible regular expression. No lookarounds, no backreferences.

any_of.description: Match any of the listed values (OR logic).

Attack.description: A single attack definition containing metadata, execution profile, and optionally detection indicators.

id.description: Unique stable identifier. Format: {PREFIX}-{NUMBER}. The OATF- prefix is reserved for the official public registry. Optional for local development.

name.description: Human-readable name for the attack. Defaults to "Untitled" when omitted.

version.description: Document version. Monotonically increasing positive integer. Higher is newer.

status.description: Lifecycle status: draft -> experimental -> stable -> deprecated.

created.description: Date/time first published. ISO 8601 datetime (2026-01-15T10:30:00Z) or bare date (2026-01-15).

modified.description: Date/time last modified. ISO 8601 datetime or bare date.

author.description: Author or organization that created this document.

description.description: Prose description of the attack: what it does, why it matters, what conditions enable it.

severity.description: Threat level. Accepts scalar string ("high") or full object with level and confidence. Optional; absent when not assessed.

impact.description: Categories of harm this attack can cause.

references.description: External references: research papers, blog posts, CVE entries, related OATF documents.

indicators.description: Patterns for determining whether the agent complied with this attack. Optional; when absent the document is valid for simulation only.

correlation.description: How indicator verdicts combine to produce the attack-level verdict.

logic.description: How indicator verdicts combine. any: at least one indicator matched means exploited. all: every indicator must match.

confidence.description: Confidence in the assigned severity level (0-100, STIX scale). 0 = no confidence, 100 = certain.

Classification.description: Maps the attack to external security frameworks and the OATF category taxonomy.

category.description: Cross-protocol attack category. Describes type of attack independent of which protocol it targets.

mappings.description: Mappings to external security frameworks (ATLAS, ATT&CK, OWASP, CWE, etc.).

tags.description: Free-form tags for filtering and discovery. Should be lowercase and hyphenated.

FrameworkMapping.description: Mapping to an entry in an external security framework.

framework.description: The external framework being referenced. Recommended values: atlas, mitre_attack, owasp_llm, owasp_mcp, owasp_agentic, cwe. Any string is accepted for custom or future frameworks.

id.description: The identifier of the specific entry within the framework.

name.description: Human-readable name of the referenced entry.

url.description: Permalink to the referenced entry in the framework's documentation.

relationship.description: How closely this attack maps to the referenced entry. Primary = directly implements; related = associated but not a direct implementation.

Reference.description: External reference providing context for the attack.

description.description: Brief description of the reference's relevance.

ExecutionProfile.description: Specifies the protocol messages an adversarial tool must produce. Supports three mutually exclusive forms: single-phase (mode + state), multi-phase (mode + phases), or multi-actor (actors array).

oneOf.description: Single-phase form: mode + state, no phases/actors.
Multi-phase form: phases (mode optional), no state/actors.

mode.description: Attacker posture. Required in single-phase form.

state.description: Protocol-specific state for this single-phase attack.

actors.description: Named concurrent actors, each targeting a protocol endpoint.

Actor.description: A named concurrent protocol endpoint in a multi-actor execution profile.

name.description: Unique actor identifier. Used in cross-actor extractor references ({{actor_name.extractor_name}}).

phases.description: Ordered phase sequence for this actor.

Phase.description: A distinct stage of the attack. Phases execute in declared order.

name.description: Human-readable label for this phase. Auto-generated as 'phase-{N}' (1-based) when omitted. Must be unique within the actor when specified.

description.description: Prose describing the purpose of this phase.

mode.description: Attacker posture for this phase. Defaults to execution.mode. Required when execution.mode is absent.

state.description: Protocol state for this phase. Structure is protocol-specific and defined by the relevant binding (spec §7). Note: this schema validates the protocol-agnostic document core only. Binding-specific state validation (MCP tools/resources/prompts structure, A2A agent card, AG-UI run input) is the responsibility of binding-aware tools.

extractors.description: Capture values from protocol messages for use in subsequent phases via {{name}} template syntax.

on_enter.description: Actions executed when this phase begins, before any client interaction.

trigger.description: Condition that triggers advancement to the next phase. Omit for terminal phase (persists indefinitely).

Extractor.description: Captures a value from a protocol message for use in subsequent phases and response templates.

name.description: Variable name. Referenced as {{name}} in templates. Last-write-wins if redefined in a later phase.

source.description: Extract from incoming requests or outgoing responses.

type.description: Extraction method. json_path: JSONPath expression (RFC 9535, first node in document order). regex: first match, first capture group.

selector.description: Extraction selector, interpreted according to type.

Action.description: An action executed on phase entry.

send_elicitation.description: Send an elicitation request to the client (MCP server-mode only).

requestedSchema.description: JSON Schema for form mode fields.

send_elicitation.description: Send an elicitation request to the client (MCP server-mode only).

requestedSchema.description: JSON Schema for form mode fields.

oneOf.description: Binding-specific entry action (no known action keys).

Trigger.description: Condition for phase advancement. Combines event matching, counting, content predicates, and duration-based advancement.

event.description: Protocol event type to match. Uses protocol-native naming (slash-separated for MCP/A2A, snake_case for AG-UI). Supports qualifier via colon syntax for simple filtering. Must be valid for the actor's mode per the Event-Mode Validity Matrix (spec §7).

count.description: Number of matching events required before advancing. Accumulates within the current phase; resets to zero on phase transition. Defaults to 1 when event is specified.

match.description: Content predicate. Phase advances only when both event type and predicate match.

after.description: Advance unconditionally after this duration from phase entry.

MatchPredicate.description: Structured conditions against protocol message content. Keys are dot-path field references (e.g., arguments.command). All conditions combine with AND. String operators are case-sensitive.

propertyNames.description: Simple dot-path field references (e.g., arguments.command). No wildcards or array indices.

Indicator.description: Pattern for determining whether the agent complied with the attack. Targets a specific protocol surface using exactly one of: pattern, expression, or semantic.

id.description: Unique identifier within this document. Auto-generated when omitted. Format validated by SDK (see V-027).

protocol.description: Protocol this indicator applies to. Defaults to the protocol component of execution.mode. Required when execution.mode is absent.

description.description: Prose describing what this indicator detects and why it is significant.

severity.description: Indicator-level severity override (level only). Overrides attack.severity.level for this indicator.

false_positives.description: Known benign scenarios that may trigger this indicator. Helps tool operators tune alerting.

PatternMatch.description: String and structural pattern matching against parsed protocol messages. Standard form uses target + condition. Shorthand places a single condition operator directly on the pattern object.

target.description: Dot-path to the field to inspect. Supports wildcards (tools[*].description). Defaults to surface's canonical target (spec §7).

condition.description: Matching condition applied to target node(s). A single operator object, or a bare value for equality matching. Required in standard form.

contains.description: Shorthand: substring match on surface default target.

starts_with.description: Shorthand: prefix match on surface default target.

ends_with.description: Shorthand: suffix match on surface default target.

regex.description: Shorthand: RE2 regex on surface default target.

any_of.description: Shorthand: match any listed value on surface default target.

gt.description: Shorthand: greater than on surface default target.

lt.description: Shorthand: less than on surface default target.

gte.description: Shorthand: greater than or equal on surface default target.

lte.description: Shorthand: less than or equal on surface default target.

oneOf.description: Standard form: explicit target and condition.
Shorthand form: single condition operator using surface default target.

ExpressionMatch.description: CEL expression evaluated against the full message context. No target field; the expression itself navigates to relevant fields.

cel.description: Common Expression Language expression evaluating to boolean. Must be side-effect-free. Available context is protocol-specific (spec §7.1.3, §7.2.3, §7.3.3).

variables.description: Named variables pre-extracted via dot-path, available to the CEL expression beyond the root message context.

SemanticMatch.description: Intent-based detection requiring an inference engine (LLM, embedding model, or classifier). Threshold is tool-relative; cross-tool interoperability depends on the examples field.

target.description: Dot-path to the field to analyze. Defaults to surface's canonical target (spec §7).

intent.description: Natural-language description of the malicious intent to detect. Used as reference for similarity or classification.
examples: Override agent behavior by impersonating system instructions within a tool description

intent_class.description: Class of malicious intent for classification-based engines.

threshold.description: Tool-relative confidence threshold (0.0-1.0). Not comparable across tools using different models. Calibrate using the examples field.

examples.description: Ground truth for calibrating inference engines. Documents should include at least 2 positive and 2 negative examples.

positive.description: Strings that should trigger this indicator.

negative.description: Strings that should not trigger this indicator.
